Prerequisites: ACG 2021 OR ACG 3024 WITH A GRADE OF C OR BETTER OR BETTER; OPEN ONLY TO BHSA MAJORS; NOT OPEN TO BUS MAJORS, CANNOT BE ATTEMPTED MORE THAN TWICE.
Course Description:
THIS COURSE WILL ENABLE STUDENTS TO ANALYZE AND INTERPRET MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING DATA USED FOR A
HEALTHCARE COMPANY'S DAILY AND FUTURE OPERATIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
OBJECTIVES:
TO OFFER AN INTRODUCTION TO THE FUNDAMENTALS OF MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING IN HOSPITALS AND HEALTHCARE
SYSTEMS.
1. USE MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING TERMINOLOGY APPROPRIATELY
2. IDENTIFY THE FORCES AFFECTING HEALTH CARE COSTS
3. USE COSTING SYSTEMS THAT ARE COMMONLY UTILIZED FOR DIFFERENT PURPOSES
4. IDENTIFY AND USE DIFFERENT ACTIVITY BASED MANAGEMENT TOOLS
5. APPLY COST RELATIONSHIPS FOR ANALYSIS
6. PREPARE CAPITAL AND OPERATIONAL BUDGETS
7. PERFORM COST VARIANCE ANALYSIS
8. CORRECTLY UTILIZE COSTS IN COSTING AND DECISIONS MAKING
9. IMPLEMENTING A RESPONSIBILITY ACCOUNTING SYSTEM
LEARNING OUTCOMES:
1.MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING AND HEALTH CARE'S IMPENDING FISCAL CRISIS
2.ESSENTIALS OF FULL-COST ACCOUNTING
3.COST BEHAVIOR
4.DIFFERENTIAL COST ACCOUNTING
5.ACTIVITY-BASED COSTING
6.RESPONSIBILITY ACCOUNTING
7.DESIGNING THE RESPONSIBILITY ACCOUNTING STRUCTURE
8.PROGRAMMING
9.OPERATIONAL BUDGETING
10.THE CASH BUDGET
11.MEASURING AND REPORTING
12.IMPLEMENTING A NEW RESPONSIBILITY ACCOUNTING SYSTEM
Textbook(s):
MANAGEMENT ACCOUNTING IN HEALTH CARE ORGANIZATIONS, 3RD EDITION
DAVID W. YOUNG
